N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 27.10 - Research involving human subjects

State Regulations
(a) Patient participation. The understanding, prevention and amelioration of mental
disability is enhanced by knowledge gained through research. Patients may
participate only in research which does not come in substantial conflict with
their individual service plans. Participation as a subject in any research
project or activity shall not deprive any patient of the rights, privileges and
protections provided to all patients by this Part. Directors of facilities
shall maintain an up-to-date list of all patients who are involved in research
projects and shall make the list available to the Mental Health Information

Service representative on request. (b) Informed consent of patients in
research projects. (1)

Informed
written consent of patients who participate as subjects must be obtained in
accordance with the requirements of section
27.9
(a) or (c)
of
this Part as applicable. (2)

If it
is clear that a patient does not have sufficient mental capacity to give
consent for participation, consent may be obtained from the facility director
if the research project director clearly demonstrates to the institution review
committee that (i) the project has overriding therapeutic importance for a
condition presented by the patient in question, and (ii) that the project could
not be carried out without the participation of patients such as the one in
question. (3)

The informed consent
required by paragraphs (1) and (2) of this subdivision must be secured in
accordance with applicable policies of the department, and the regulations of

Federal agencies which are applicable to such research before projects or
activities may be approved. (c) Approval by division of
research. Research projects or activity involving patients are
subject to department approval under the policies and procedures of the
division of research. Experimental drugs or treatment procedures may be used
only after the proposed procedure has been submitted to the division of
research for review and specific written approval has been granted in each
instance. Notes
